title: PSA if your jungler is in the lane bush waiting for the enemy laner to push up
body: Don't push against him and simply last hit.

replies.body:
Thats a pretty good way to telegraph that your jungle is nearby.

Like lets say im pushing hard into you then i just randomly back off for no reason, clearly something is up.
You shouldn't be hard pushing anyway, you should be last hitting unless poking.
There are matchups that thrive on pushing your enemy in under tower.

Those match ups tend to be mages who either don't have waveclear or don't have enough mana to waveclear effectively early on. In top and bottom lane, you shouldn't be trying to shove down as opposed to freezing the lane at least in most match ups.

Whenever im vsing a vayne i always push her straight under tower early on when possible and safe. Same goes for a few other adc's. Especially in gold and below when a lot of supports don't know how to help their adc farm under tower early on. Same goes for top lane. As long as you have vision there is no reason not be pushing your lane opponent under tower to create possible advantages for yourself and your team.
Even if most people could pick up on that, nothing gets done,
